entry.title: Stephen Hawking - The greatest enemy of

link.title: Stephen Hawking - The greatest enemy of

entry.content:
The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.

  • Stephen Hawking
entry.summary: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.

entry.title: Dalai Lama - Love and compassion are

link.title: Dalai Lama - Love and compassion are

entry.content:
Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.

  • Dalai Lama
entry.summary: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.

entry.title: Jack Kornfield - If your compassion does not

link.title: Jack Kornfield - If your compassion does not

entry.content:
If your compassion does not include yourself, it is incomplete.

  • Jack Kornfield
entry.summary: If your compassion does not include yourself, it is incomplete.

entry.title: Jack Kornfield - The path of awakening is not

link.title: Jack Kornfield - The path of awakening is not

entry.content:
The path of awakening is not about becoming who you are. Rather it is about unbecoming who you are not.

  • Jack Kornfield
entry.summary: The path of awakening is not about becoming who you are. Rather it is about unbecoming who you are not.

entry.title: Pema Chödrön - The most fundamental
entry.content:
The most fundamental aggression to ourselves, the most fundamental harm we can cause ourselves, is to remain ignorant by not having the courage and the curiosity to look at ourselves honestly and gently.

  • Pema Chödrön
entry.summary: The most fundamental aggression to ourselves, the most fundamental harm we can cause ourselves, is to remain ignorant by not having the courage and the curiosity to look at ourselves honestly and gently.

entry.title: Pema Chödrön - The only way to make sense

link.title: Pema Chödrön - The only way to make sense

entry.content:
The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.

  • Pema Chödrön
entry.summary: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.

entry.title: Thich Nhat Hanh - Feelings come and go like

link.title: Thich Nhat Hanh - Feelings come and go like

entry.content:
Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.

  • Thich Nhat Hanh
entry.summary: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.

entry.title: Thich Nhat Hanh - The present moment is filled

link.title: Thich Nhat Hanh - The present moment is filled

entry.content:
The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.

  • Thich Nhat Hanh
entry.summary: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.

entry.title: Ada Lovelace - That brain of mine is

link.title: Ada Lovelace - That brain of mine is

entry.content:
That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal; as time will show.

  • Ada Lovelace
entry.summary: That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal; as time will show.

entry.title: Ada Lovelace - The Analytical Engine does

link.title: Ada Lovelace - The Analytical Engine does

entry.content:
The Analytical Engine does not occupy that abstract region of the mind, but is a real machine that can calculate.

  • Ada Lovelace
entry.summary: The Analytical Engine does not occupy that abstract region of the mind, but is a real machine that can calculate.
